text: Begonia bonus-henricus is a species of plant in the family Begoniaceae. It is endemic to Cameroon. Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests. It is threatened by habitat loss.Cheek, M. 2004. Begonia bonus-henricus. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 20 August 2007. It was named after Hendrik de Wit. ==References== bonus-henricus Category:Flora of Cameroon Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Begonia bonus-henricus
